A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Don't listen to those giving this movie half a star or 1 star. This is a fantastically made film and a worthy addition to the Star Wars canon. Is it perfect? No. The second act drags\, one of the plotlines is boring\, the porgs are clearly a cynical marketing/merchandise tool and there is a certain \"deus ex machina\" quality to some events. But there is so much to love here - the cinematography\, the character development\, the practical effects\, the battles and the twists are all second-to-none. I don't think I've been this surprised and this engaged with a Star Wars film since Episode V. The thing that really makes this movie a 4.5 star\, rather than just a 4 star\, however\, is the risks it takes; it assumes the audience has a modicum of intelligence; it writes its main characters as realistic people with hopes and fears; in one scene especially\, it explores the psyche of a character and the influence that their weaknesses have over them. Best of all for a Star Wars film\, it's different. If you love Star Wars\, go see it with an open mind. If you love movies\, you won't be disappointed.
